alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 11:24PM EST until December 24 at 7:36PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Pemigewasset River At Plymouth affecting BelknapGrafton Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Pemigewasset River At Woodstock affecting Grafton County. Baker River At Rumney affecting Grafton County. For the Pemigewasset River...including Woodstock, Plymouth...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Baker River...including Rumney...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pemigewasset River at Plymouth. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins. At 14.0 feet, Water enters the parking lot behind the PSU ice arena. At 15.0 feet, Flood waters up to the road at the Irving station on route 175A in Holderness. At 15.5 feet, Flood waters over the road at the Irving station on route 175A in Holderness. At 18.0 feet, South River Road and Avery Street flood in Holderness. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 14.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM EST Friday was 14.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage around midday tomorrow. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
